text: Kim Jun-ho (born 9 October 1995) is a speed skater from South Korea. Kim was at the 2014 Winter Olympics. She skated for South Korea. She was 21st in the 500 metres. Kim won a bronze medal at the 500 m in the 2013 World Junior Championships. Kim was at his first World Cup in November 2013. His best World Cup finish is in 15th in a 500 m race at Berlin in 2013–14. His best overall finish in the World Cup is 30th. This was in the 500 metres in 2013–14. ==Education== *Korea National Sport University *Kangwon Physical High School *Namchuncheon Middle School *The Attached Elementary School of Chuncheon National University of Education ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1995 births Category:Living people Category:Speed skaters Category:Sportspeople from Seoul Category:Competitors at the 2018 Winter Olympics Category:Competitors at the 2025 Asian Winter Games
title: Kim Jun-ho (speed skater)
